job_title: Product Manager in Bedok New Town,
pros: Good salary and flexible time
cons: Far from downtown and old office

pros: Easy to get hired for a position
cons: It’s marketed as a flexible position however, they expect you to work over the required 8 hours. There is no overtime pay. when on call, you work essentially acting the clock for a week straight, for an extra $75 in your paycheck. Improper training. They offer a sign on bonus, don’t tell you it’s performance based, then don’t give you the bonus because you didn’t meet performance expectations, that they didn’t train you for.

pros: The clients and families are great. The idea of building families is a great idea.
cons: Over worked, under appreciated, made to work long hours. Upper management is not held accountable for the lack of others work. If you are a friend, you get a pass and other have to clean up. Mileage is a joke, if you get it at all. The formula to even get mileage, is a joke. The management googles the distance you are supposed to go. If you are a mile over for any reason and don’t take the shortest route , you don’t get the mileage. So don’t get lost or rerouted. You will get punished. The company keeps working people harder and continues to take incentives, and other perks of the job away. Flexible work hours, ha ha that is completely untrue. I have never worked as much with as little salary. Upper management is just awful and could care leads about employees. The number of kids is all that matters. You get yelled at for not placing children and told you are not doing your job. Turnover rate is huge offices are exhausted.

job_title: Targeted Case Manager in Florence, KY
pros: The staff is helpful and compassionate towards one another. Teamwork is a staple.
cons: There are not enough male staff or male therapist for those who request it.

job_title: Mental Health Skill Builder in Pedro, OH
pros: Get paid to sleep impossible tombe fired
cons: Hourly wages, understaffed, unorganized, lack communication in all areas of the company

pros: I love this company! Their forward thinking ideas around child welfare are truly going to change the industry for the better and help so many kids. I'm just happy to be part of something special.
cons: Wish more people came in to the office every day instead of working from home, but I get it.

pros: Flexibility with schedule, Leadership, Culture, Teamwork
cons: New hire training practices need updated.

review_title: It Was Awful to Have a Poor Culture and No Diversity
pros: I was good at my job, so I could take care of the work. So, the only pro I experienced was due to my skills only.
cons: The workload was insane, and the travel time was awful too. The stress and exhaustion I experienced from constant travel from one part of the state to another were terrible. Two more things I severely disliked were the lack of culture and no diversity. It was ridiculous and made the workplace ambiance a bit toxic and hostile. The top management must fix it!

pros: I learned a few things from my work
cons: Most of the employees in this company are insanely stressed and overworked. The management keeps dumping various tasks on the employees. The managers create a lot of pressure in the workplace, causing employees to feel stressed and exhausted very quickly. It is not a good feeling to work for this company.

review_title: MOST STRESSFUL I'VE EVER BEEN AND MOST EXHAUSTING YET!
pros: There was flexibility at work and schedule sometimes, but that only means working longer hours.
cons: We're harassed to work long brutal hours, and I feel physically abused by the arduous work! The overwhelming tension was caused by the management who like to blame a lot of things on us employees. Working here was the MOST STRESSFUL I'VE EVER BEEN AND MOST EXHAUSTING YET!

pros: good company lots of projects, and wide range of experience
cons: salary delay with more than 2 months

review_title: I should have trusted my instincts...
pros: Awesome clients, good flexibility, mostly make your own schedule.
cons: Local office very toxic, overworked with paperwork taking away from client interaction.

pros: Necco offers a work culture that is unmet by any previous employer I have had! Their new hire training is thorough and your role and expectations are clear from the start. By working for a company that upholds their core values and how they treat their employees, adds ambition to the work you do, as well as a drive to perform better while keeping our most important task on the forefront, the CHILD. I have now worked for Necco for 3 years and have had the opportunity of growth into 2 leadership positions.
cons: Boundaries are important with this job. You will need to find what works for you to balance work and personal life. It is manageable, but at times can be difficult.

pros: Work from home option Laid back environment Good PTO
cons: Overworked Ridiculous expectations No support Mediocre Pay No room for growth

pros: Free trainings with CEUs, clinical supervision, flexible schedule, casual dress, believes in social impact, awesome corporate culture, very supportive supervisors and team, able to work from home, a lot of holidays and PTO available, monthly incentive, quarterly bonus.
cons: Workload is high, hard to manage and hard to balance work and personal life, salaries tend to be lower than other places, work is demanding, paperwork is difficult to keep up with, and expectation to do home/community based services with no mileage reimbursement and no consideration how far the drive is to some clients.

pros: Many passionate employees work here. Our clients are amazing.
cons: Every single therapist in this company is overworked. The management makes us work for extra long hours because of the high demand. But this is at the expense of our mental and physical well-being. We also often have to fill in for some of our colleagues because the managers force us to do so.

review_title: Employees are mistreated by the managers
pros: The job itself can make people join and stay in this company. But the overall work atmosphere is far from welcoming.
cons: The employees here are constantly being mistreated by the management. The management does not accomplish its job of leading and managing the employees. Instead, it constantly degrades the people who work hard in this company. It is filled with the worst kinds of managers the no one would ever wish to work for. Please save yourself from the horrible experience of working for the management in this company.

job_title: Qualified Mental Health Specialist in Pedro, OH
pros:
The kids were amazing.
Everyday was different.
cons:
Management was awful and you only became , “one of them”, by being friends and kissing up, to them. It was very unfair and they would “fix” who won certain positions, by telling each member of the interviews who to vote for. The entire thing was rigged.

If you didn’t kiss up to certain people by sending 100’s of “way to go” emails all day, you werent liked.

pros: Great team and fun atmosphere! They very passionate about the work they do, all the way up to the top. Extremely flexible hours, 6 weeks PTO, and supervisors who care about you as a person. Knowing that every single position here helps a foster child at the end of the day is the reason I love Necco and what they stand for.
cons: They are still working out a lot of systems and processes and having all the office align. They are working on this through talent management redesign.

review_title: Low pay, lower mileage reimbursement for a job that is 80% driving
pros: Flexible schedule and laid back environment
cons: Very low pay, mileage reimbursement is basically nonexistent for a job that has employees driving upwards of 700-1000+ miles per month. Employee concerns aren’t heard or valued. Disorganized, lack of professionalism and structure.

pros: Laid back, easy going but overall rewarding
cons: Promotion only could happen if you had a degree

pros: No cubicles! Great culture and awesome benefits! Management is supportive and ideas are considered regardless of job title. It's like a big family.... we don't always get along, but we always have each other's back. Working for a great cause with a great team. Offers a lot of room for growth. I feel valued at Necco.
cons: Workload can get a be a lot at times and feel a little overwhelming.

review_title: Mission-driven org dedicated to its people
job_title: Human Resources Specialist (HR Specialist) in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Great PTO policy, strong company culture, and rewarding work. They value career pathing and encourage growth, so if you want to move up in this company they will help you map your pathway. Lots of recognition and rewards for doing difficult work.
cons: This is a constantly growing company so there may be periods where you take on a little more here and there, but as a team, and never alone in my experience.

pros: flexible schedule, great company values
cons: doesn't pay mileage, on call schedule

pros:
Close relationships within your team
Opportunity for autonomy
Available CEUs and coverage for expanding education
cons:
Cult-like mentality “Team Necco”
No mileage reimbursement for a community base program
No hot spots or phone AND no stipends or support for using your own
Poor boundaries masked under “sacrifice and assist”

pros: Be wary of all the 5* reviews..... Working with the families is amazing
cons: Any "perfect" review for this company should be taken with a grain of salt...super high turnover because the upper management and state level execs are very unqualified for the positions they hold Several supervisors and managers are actually related and show preference over those that actually work

pros: Great Culture! It's nice to know that you're working for a purpose and that is to make this world a better place for the children, families and young adults that need us. You don't have to be part of direct care to make a difference. The flexibility is awesome. Unmatched PTO program.
cons: Need to be a self-starter and be a good cultural fit.

review_title: There's a lot of FRUSTRATION and STRESS
pros: There's always some training going on and it could be a good excuse to get off work sometimes.
cons: In here, everything's about complying with and maintaining standards and objectives whatever it takes. This job includes a LOT of FRUSTRATION and STRESS, which management doesn't seem to care about. It already feels too TOXIC at times where it gets hard to breathe and makes it more exhausting!

review_title: Great Place for Beginners in the Field
job_title: Community Case Manager in South Point, OH
pros: Competitive Starting Pay Fun and Supportive Environment An Opportunity for Professional Growth. This is a place where your ideas and thoughts matter!
cons: Long work hours sometimes Challenging workload Lots of driving

pros: I cannot say enough good things about this company. It has been such a blessing to work for. They truly do have one of the best work environments, best people and best mission!
cons: The pay could be a bit better and there isn’t any paid mileage-but it’s otherwise amazing.

pros: -Regardless of your position, you get to impact a child's life EVERY DAY! -Progressive company culture that doesn't reflect your normal "top down management" styles. -Meritocracy Rules... the best idea wins regardless of structural power.
cons: - MUST be a good cultural "fit" - MUST easily adapt to change

pros: Lots of flexibility, good work environment
cons: Changes needing made regarding compensation and incentives.

pros: Supervisors are very supportive and always encourage our team to be the best! I really enjoy my job, my foster parents, and my team.
cons: Compensation for mileage because of high priced gas

pros: Team environment, good culture when everyone practices it, flexible schedule, average pay, good benefits, incredible mission
cons: No mileage reimbursement and using personal car

pros: Great company and great culture! Passionate about the kids and building families, but equally as concerned about maintaining the company culture.
cons: High turn over in some of the offices.

pros: Great purpose carried out by great people
cons: Like everywhere else turnover has been high lately

pros: They really want to help kids but ….
cons: Management really mistreats all the employees. No-one at corporate can do anything without being condemned by the inept executive team

pros: Flexible schedule, great team to work with
cons: Unrealistic goals, high case loads

pros: Flexibility in the work expected
cons: CEO sexually harassed women and created a hostile work environment

job_title: Director of Information Technology in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Great company culture, above average pay and benefits, fun, excellent work/life harmony, excellent mission and social purpose, upward career growth.
cons: I worked in the corporate office and it was fantastic.

job_title: Home Resource Coordinator in Albany, GA
pros: Autonomy, your own office, flexibility to handle personal business, relaxed dress code and work environment, nice and clean work environment
cons: Low pay, no training, no support from office management, popularity contest to be liked and get opportunities, everyone talks about each other. They talk badly about interviewees and don't like to hire men, your experience will depend on the office you work at because mine did not exemplify the company culture and values that they post and claim to be about. They don't care about you at all unless you are in the popular circle. The managers were very unprofessional and you really couldn't tell the difference between who was a manager and who wasn't. They don't like free thinkers or people who dont agree with them.

job_title: Home Resource Coordinator in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Easy going work environment, try to be trendy
cons: Don’t care much about lower employees…only supervisors. No real truth to power

pros: Flexibility is the best pro.
cons: High employee turnover  that affects whole office.

pros: Great Company, lots of paid time off
cons: Not great at training new employees

pros: Executive Leadership changed for several states and on the corporate level- causing the culture, everyone once’s loved, to shift with a huge negative ripple effect throughout the company.
cons: Culture needs to focus on the people and not the numbers

pros:

pros: I enjoy the work I do. I love working with our foster kids and families. My colleagues are tremendously helpful. My boss is approachable, informative, and efficient. Everyone is a team player here.
cons: I dont get paid mileage for my travel.

review_title: If could give 0 stars I would
pros: Working with the families and kids
cons: EVERYTHING ELSE.... management is horrible, several sups are related and create a toxic work office....... Reported several issues to corporate and nothing was changed

pros: The people I worked with were great.
cons: Terrible pay, overworked, high caseloads, the people at the top did not care about employees or the kids. Sessions were for making money not treating patients.

job_title: Case Manager in Bowling Green, KY
pros: Rewarding working with kids, work from home during Covid, gift cards and free lunches
cons: Poor management, unrealistic expectations, micromanaged, stressful

pros: Nothing unless you want a meaningless existence.. but helping people you are not.
cons: The lie about the pay and benefits. They lie about caseloads and accommodations. And they treat children like cattle... its about heads and dollar signs to these people. I quit in two weeks. If your object is to help kids, stay away from this place!!!!

pros: flexible hours, engaging office culture, impactful work, self directed work
cons: social services salary, self directed work

pros: Benefits,Pay,Ethics, Management ,Ownership are all great.
cons: Not enough foster parents for all of the children who need safe homes.

pros:
PTO is generous
Knowledgeable staff
Very diverse and inclusive hiring
cons:

Company culture is preached but rarely demonstrated
It is about the ‘numbers’ not the services or clients

pros: Striving work culture, meritocracy, truth the power
cons: ambiguity, lack of clarity, functional teams, growing pains.

pros: Flexible and you are able to contribute to growth/changes
cons: No regular raises. Uses the balanced scorecard.

pros: You can wear whatever you want
cons: Pay is bad, hard to get a raise and move up and they don’t really care about their employees

pros: They do good work here.

pros: Set your own schedule sometimes.
cons: Very long hours, low pay for the work, only focused on billing and not quality of services.

job_title: Mental Health Specialist in South Point, OH
pros: family oriented, great benefits, loving.
cons: nothing is wrong with the company in my opinion.

pros: Great environment to work at
cons: No cons at all. Very

pros: There is nothing good about this company.
cons: Everything. Don’t waste your time here.

review_title: Not what I thought it would be
pros: vacation time is very good
cons: You can only get ahead if you are a favorite. They don't care what you know they only care if you know more than they do because that makes them mad. Employees come and go as they please, work from home without permission and seem to be in more meetings discussing why they don't like each other instead of really trying to get the work done.

job_title: EHR Systems Analyst in Cincinnati, OH
pros: I started at NECCO a little over a year ago as an Administrative Specialist with no prior social work experience, with the 5-year goal of moving into an IT position. In no time I was calling foster parents for placements, teaching pre-service classes, and facilitating building a presence in other areas of the state. A year later, I got my position in the IT Department. The culture is great, the mission is great, you have the opportunity to be a part of something truly amazing. Advancement opportunities are there if you're willing to work hard. I've got my dream job now!
cons: The salary is low. However, you are incentivized on performance and bonus opportunities are abundant as well. The hours can be long, especially when crises happen with kiddos, but the flexibility makes up for that.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bowling Green, KY
pros: There were lots of opportunities to earn extra money; the work with foster youth is rewarding, and office provided incentives like free lunches frequently.
cons: BG office had a negative culture, with some employees favored over others. Lots of gossip and mean chatter behind people’s backs. Friendships were encouraged but much of it was fake. Foster homes were not evaluated for the quality of care they would provide to a foster child, but instead for padding the numbers, leading to many unfit foster families who were only doing it for the money. Complaints were not addressed if they were against the “favored” employees but were overaddressed with others. Overall a discouraging and negative place to work.

pros: Being able to make a difference in the lives of children is rewarding.  The people at The Necco Center are friendly and helpful.
cons: I have a Bachelors Degree and do not make enough to pay my bills, let alone live comfortably.  Also, it is easy to get discouraged when hard work goes unnoticed.

pros:
Solid organizational culture with many events and 'bonus' opportunities tied to participation in events.  
Leadership knows its stuff and is very interested in employee development.
Tuition reimbursement.
Generous time off.
Each satellite office is self-directed, providing a sense of autonomy and 'ownership'.
Matching 403B.
Plenty of room for career advancement if you are a social worker or therapist.
cons:
Health care benefits are not great.
Culture is definitely single track and not a lot of room for real diversity.

pros: The corporate culture at Necco is wonderful!  It's such a fun place to work and the bonuses are very generous.
cons: As a therapist, I was expected to travel to several different counties across Kentucky each week just to meet with my clients.  It really took away from the face-to-face time I had to spend with each client.

pros: The people I work with are  phenomenal. The job is challenging yet fulfilling. Great room for growth.
cons: Doesn't believe in annual raises.

pros: Very flexible work schedule: Work from home often, Almost entirely self-directed.
cons: Travel often, Pay is low but somewhat fair for social services, Large workload, Marginal leadership development practices, Slim advancement opportunities in management.

review_title: Ok, culture is good, pay is horrible
job_title: Home Resource Coordinator in Lexington-Fayette, KY
pros: Culture, flexibility, taking caring of vulnerable kids, fun environment, work truly matters, events offered for staff, able to express yourself, many perks
cons: Pay is not enough is support yourself much less a family. People at corporate do not understand the current needs, too many meeting- meetings about meetings.

pros: The culture is there. Great people to work with.
cons: Poor pay, benefits etc for all roles. Clearly, they’re not keeping up with what these roles should be paid. It’s a for profit company and that money should do more than stay at the top.

pros: I have worked at Necco for 3 years.  In that time, I have grown professionally and personally because they have provided me the opportunity to do so. Necco is not top-down management like other places I have worked.  There is a great deal of trust and no need to micromanage,
cons: You must be organized and disciplined to work here!

pros: After working for this company, it will be difficult for any other job to measure up to the level of teamwork, praise, concern, and positive working culture. Very flexible schedule, excellent bonuses and opportunities to earn extra money, care and concern for consumers, and upward mobility.
cons: Communication at times and improvising.

review_title: Be a Part of Something Great!
pros:
As a NECCO employee I can be a part of a company that makes a difference in many lives including our clients and employees. The culture is casual but committed. The entrepreneurial spirit is energizing and fun. 
Great benefits.  Generous PTO.  Growing business.
cons: No cons at this time.

pros: Necco provided excellent perks and chances to make extra money. There was also the chance to work on flex time. Ample vacation and sick pay.
cons: The environment is one of the most unprofessional I've ever witnessed. The program director is unable to address concerns with employees directly. The office reminded me of the movie "Mean Girls." The PD picked favorites and talked openly about other employees with them. PD routinely made disparaging remarks about foster parents certified through the agency.  Office morale was abysmal.

pros: Flexible schedule, great co workers, and  really enjoyable clients
cons: Poor management, money driven, lack of respect from management to employees,  no transparency — no following or corporate culture, at all.

pros: Casual dress. Occasional incentives.
cons: Horrible benefits, the initial niceness fades once you leave with HR and staff, gossip, disorganized, lots of running in circles and not following of state guidelines, no raises, no proper training.

pros: Fast paced, progressive.  Values quality and training.  Culture is great.  Bonuses and free food.  Emphasis on rewarding great staff. By far the best environment in the field of foster care/social work.
cons: Evening and weekend work.  Long hours at times, but VERY flexible schedule.

review_title: Great organization to be a part of!
pros: You have the opportunity and encouragement to grow both personally and professionally. Great team environment and supportive management. Most importantly, you are a part of a greater mission and have a direct impact on your community.
cons: none. I really enjoy working at Necco

pros: True team environment and support from supervisors.great training opportunities
cons: Hard to find good people willing to work

pros: The culture is flexible and dynamic.  The people are amazing and the mission is so fulfilling!
cons: There are no cons in my opinion.

pros: the companies mission is great...they  value there employees...lots of room for advancement....growing everyday...great benefits
cons: not enough time in the day

pros: Flexible schedule, good co workers, incentives
cons: Work hours, driving/ mileage , stress,

pros: The positive climate and open door policy. Your are not micromanaged and are treated like equals.
cons: Salary could be higher based on length of experience.

pros: Get to pick your own schedule.
cons: Work can be few and far in between depending on the number of families you have.

pros: Great corporate culture, flexible schedules and a generous PTO policy make Necco a great place to work.
cons: Not anything bad to say!

pros: Great kids and some coworkers who are really passionate about what they do.
cons: Difficult company standards and appear to focus more on money than clients.

pros:
-Good management with a plan
-Lots of opportunities to do different things and grow career
cons: -Tough industry and business

pros: Family Oriented , Flexible, concern about their employees,
cons: Salary, lack of training, benefits can be better
